com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.networkconnection
Class CodecPolicyTest

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.TestBase
              com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.MediaSessionBase
                  com.hp.opencall.jmsc.test.mandatory.functional.networkconnection.CodecPolicyTest
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
public class CodecPolicyTest
extends MediaSessionBase

Test the functionalities of a CodecPolicy.

All test cases proceed as follows:

  • Select one of two arbitrarily built SDP offers. One is a rich offer with many codecs, the other one is minimal with only PCMU. Both are audio-only, and defined by static Strings in this class: minimalOffer, richOffer.
  • Prepare a CodecPolicy with the tested characteritics.
  • Create a NetworkConnection, set the CodecPolicy to its SdpPortManager, and call SdpPortManager.processSdpOffer(byte[]) with the selected SDP.
  • Run assertions on the following: Exception or not, completion event with success or not, content of SDP answer.
    See applyPolicyToOffer(String, CodecPolicy, boolean) for details.
The expected setup failures are caused by
  • no remaining media-type
  • no remaining codec
  • missing required codec

The media server must support at least PCMU, PCMA, AMR and telephone-event.

Note: the fact that the preferences are reflected in the SDP answer is not tested. The media server may decide to use a different codec, and this is not controllable by the testcase.
